column4: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Minella Study, 9/4 One Horse Town, 5/1 Arnolphe, 8/1 Cinammon Coco,  Macshadow Des Crai, 14/1 Winston Junior, 16/1 Matiwo, 20/1 Wolf Rayet, 25/1 Crooked Path, 33/1 Westlain
column36: Made it 2-2 over hurdles with Listed win at Wetherby and he's a major player
column37: Ex-Irish; went close on stable debut on the Flat in October and made it 2-2 over hurdles with Listed win at Wetherby (2m, good) later that month; showed promise on soft going on the Flat; major player under 7lb penalty.

column4: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Minella Study, 9/4 One Horse Town, 5/1 Arnolphe, 8/1 Cinammon Coco,  Macshadow Des Crai, 14/1 Winston Junior, 16/1 Matiwo, 20/1 Wolf Rayet, 25/1 Crooked Path, 33/1 Westlain
column36: Made all in Grade 2 here four weeks ago; 4-4 over hurdles and he's a leading contender
column37: Highly progressive since sent over hurdles, making it 4-4 in this code (various ground) when making all in Grade 2 here four weeks ago; he's a leading contender under a 7lb penalty.

column4: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Minella Study, 9/4 One Horse Town, 5/1 Arnolphe, 8/1 Cinammon Coco,  Macshadow Des Crai, 14/1 Winston Junior, 16/1 Matiwo, 20/1 Wolf Rayet, 25/1 Crooked Path, 33/1 Westlain
column36: One win from his four hurdle runs; place claims but improvement needed to come out on top
column37: Off the mark over hurdles at the third attempt at Down Royal (2m1f, good) in August; held in fourth at Punchestown (2m, good to yielding) next time before AW maiden win; place claims but improvement is necessary if he's to come out on top today.

column4: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Minella Study, 9/4 One Horse Town, 5/1 Arnolphe, 8/1 Cinammon Coco,  Macshadow Des Crai, 14/1 Winston Junior, 16/1 Matiwo, 20/1 Wolf Rayet, 25/1 Crooked Path, 33/1 Westlain
column36: Easy win at 66-1 at Fontwell; tougher task here but trainer has fine recent record in race
column37: Fair maiden on the Flat who won by 12l at 66-1 in a first-time hood (retained) at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft) on his second hurdle start; this is a much tougher assignment but his stable won the last two runnings (dead-heat last year) and it remains to be seen how far he can go in this code.

column4: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Minella Study, 9/4 One Horse Town, 5/1 Arnolphe, 8/1 Cinammon Coco,  Macshadow Des Crai, 14/1 Winston Junior, 16/1 Matiwo, 20/1 Wolf Rayet, 25/1 Crooked Path, 33/1 Westlain
column36: From a talented family; represents top trainer and could have a part to play on debut
column37: 12th foal; half-brother to four winners including Candide (7f 2yo including Group 3; 2m1f-2m2f hurdle, jumps RPR 139) and Avenue Kennedy (10.7f Flat and 2m1f-2m2f hurdle/chase, jumps RPR 123); makes debut in a tongue-tie; represents top trainer and he could have a part to play.

column4: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Minella Study, 9/4 One Horse Town, 5/1 Arnolphe, 8/1 Cinammon Coco,  Macshadow Des Crai, 14/1 Winston Junior, 16/1 Matiwo, 20/1 Wolf Rayet, 25/1 Crooked Path, 33/1 Westlain
column36: Has shown promise over hurdles but 0-10 overall and improvement is needed today
column37: He's raced four times over hurdles and has run pretty well to make the frame on his last three outings (2m/1m7f, yielding/good); however, he's 0-10 overall and improvement is needed if he's to get off the mark today.

column4: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Minella Study, 9/4 One Horse Town, 5/1 Arnolphe, 8/1 Cinammon Coco,  Macshadow Des Crai, 14/1 Winston Junior, 16/1 Matiwo, 20/1 Wolf Rayet, 25/1 Crooked Path, 33/1 Westlain
column36: Made the frame on all three starts in France; has joined leading stable for British career
column37: Made the frame in two French bumpers (1m4f, very soft/good to soft) and did likewise on hurdle debut there (2m1f, soft) in June; needs something extra on his British debut but he's joined a leading stable and it will be no surprise if he's in the shake-up.

column4: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Minella Study, 9/4 One Horse Town, 5/1 Arnolphe, 8/1 Cinammon Coco,  Macshadow Des Crai, 14/1 Winston Junior, 16/1 Matiwo, 20/1 Wolf Rayet, 25/1 Crooked Path, 33/1 Westlain
column36: 40-1 third on debut; sizeable step forward needed but trainer does well with this type
column37: 40-1 third behind easy winner (a subsequent Listed runner-up) on debut at Chepstow (2m, good) in October; a sizeable step forward is needed today but it was an encouraging start to his career and his trainer does well with juvenile hurdlers; this half-brother to useful hurdler Lucky One could go well.

column4: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Minella Study, 9/4 One Horse Town, 5/1 Arnolphe, 8/1 Cinammon Coco,  Macshadow Des Crai, 14/1 Winston Junior, 16/1 Matiwo, 20/1 Wolf Rayet, 25/1 Crooked Path, 33/1 Westlain
column36: Useful Flat maiden who was a promising second on hurdle debut and is open to improvement
column37: Useful maiden on the Flat in Ireland who was a promising second of five on hurdle/stable debut at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft) in October; that form reads well and he's open to improvement in this code; chance.

column4: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Minella Study, 9/4 One Horse Town, 5/1 Arnolphe, 8/1 Cinammon Coco,  Macshadow Des Crai, 14/1 Winston Junior, 16/1 Matiwo, 20/1 Wolf Rayet, 25/1 Crooked Path, 33/1 Westlain
column36: Encouraging second on hurdle debut but a chunk of improvement is necessary today
column37: Limited in light Flat career; half a length ahead of Matiwo when 11l runner-up on hurdle/stable debut at Chepstow (2m, good) in October; can win races in this code but a chunk of improvement is needed if he's to land this one; wears a first-time tongue-tie.

column4: Michael Eakins Senior Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Jukebox Kid, 4/1 First Confession, 9/2 Zertakt, 6/1 As The Fella Says, 8/1 Doughmore Bay,  Holokea, 14/1 Risk De Pluie, 25/1 Hillcrest
column36: Impressed on last month's chase/handicap debut and a 9lb rise may not stop him today
column37: Point (3m, heavy) and novice hurdle (2m4f, good to soft) winner who made it three wins from his four starts when scoring by 4l on last month's chase and handicap debut at Carlisle (2m5f, good to soft); hit with a 9lb rise but that may not stop this highly likeable prospect.

column4: Michael Eakins Senior Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Jukebox Kid, 4/1 First Confession, 9/2 Zertakt, 6/1 As The Fella Says, 8/1 Doughmore Bay,  Holokea, 14/1 Risk De Pluie, 25/1 Hillcrest
column36: Returned from long absence with encouraging run at Windsor; handy mark for chase debut
column37: Progressive handicap hurdler in 2023-24 and he returned from a long absence with an encouraging third of five at Windsor three weeks ago; showed promise in a point-to-point in 2022 (leading when falling two out) and he has a handy mark to work with on his chase debut; interesting.

column4: Michael Eakins Senior Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Jukebox Kid, 4/1 First Confession, 9/2 Zertakt, 6/1 As The Fella Says, 8/1 Doughmore Bay,  Holokea, 14/1 Risk De Pluie, 25/1 Hillcrest
column36: Promising 3rd on Carlisle chase debut; didn't build on it at Kempton but retains potential
column37: Point (3m, heavy) and novice hurdle (2m3f, good) winner who stayed on for 10l third behind The Jukebox Kid on chase debut at Carlisle (2m5f, good to soft) last month; failed to build on that when third of seven at Kempton (3m, good) but retains potential and could be a contender.

column4: Michael Eakins Senior Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Jukebox Kid, 4/1 First Confession, 9/2 Zertakt, 6/1 As The Fella Says, 8/1 Doughmore Bay,  Holokea, 14/1 Risk De Pluie, 25/1 Hillcrest
column36: Returned from very long absence last season and unable to get competitive over fences
column37: Showed star potential in 2021-22 novice hurdle campaign but returned from a very long absence last season and this 10yo has been unable to get competitive over fences; others are preferred.

column4: Michael Eakins Senior Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Jukebox Kid, 4/1 First Confession, 9/2 Zertakt, 6/1 As The Fella Says, 8/1 Doughmore Bay,  Holokea, 14/1 Risk De Pluie, 25/1 Hillcrest
column36: 6yo who has improved for fences and the stiff finish should be right up his street
column37: Two-time point winner who has improved for fences (on good and soft ground), winning over 3m1f at Ffos Las in October on his second chase start and runner at Uttoxeter (3m2f) since; this stiff finish should be right up his street and this unexposed 6yo could be in the mix.

column4: Michael Eakins Senior Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Jukebox Kid, 4/1 First Confession, 9/2 Zertakt, 6/1 As The Fella Says, 8/1 Doughmore Bay,  Holokea, 14/1 Risk De Pluie, 25/1 Hillcrest
column36: 0-6 over fences but consistent and there's every chance he'll be thereabouts
column37: Three hurdle wins in France; 0-6 over fences in Britain but he's consistent and was outstayed when runner-up on his reappearance at Newcastle (3m6f, good to soft) a fortnight ago; every chance he'll be thereabouts.

column4: Michael Eakins Senior Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Jukebox Kid, 4/1 First Confession, 9/2 Zertakt, 6/1 As The Fella Says, 8/1 Doughmore Bay,  Holokea, 14/1 Risk De Pluie, 25/1 Hillcrest
column27: S C E A Haras Du Ma & Mr Marc Dumont
column36: 3m point winner for whom today's test of stamina could unlock some improvement; chance
column37: Runner-up over fences on his last three starts (soft/good), most recently when upped to 2m6f at Lingfield on his reappearance; this 6yo won a 3m point in December 2023 and it's possible today's test of stamina will unlock some improvement; he's one to consider.

column4: Michael Eakins Senior Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 2/1 The Jukebox Kid, 4/1 First Confession, 9/2 Zertakt, 6/1 As The Fella Says, 8/1 Doughmore Bay,  Holokea, 14/1 Risk De Pluie, 25/1 Hillcrest
column36: Lightly raced 6yo who was 2nd on chase debut; in excellent hands to continue to progress
column37: 3m point winner (good to yielding) who was lightly raced over hurdles and improved upon that form when 1l second of six on last month's chase and seasonal debut at Southwell (2m4f, soft); in excellent hands to continue to progress and he's a possible player.

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: Has raised her game each season, over fences this term; interesting back up in trip
column37: Has raised her game each season, over fences this term when she won a handicap at Ayr (2m, soft) in November; respectable fourth of five at Wetherby (1m7f) four weeks ago and she now steps back up in trip, having won over nearly 2m6f on soft as a hurdler in March; interesting.

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: Concern about her jumping last term and it was clearly a problem on last month's return
column37: Four hurdle wins; chasing on last five starts, with some concern about her jumping last season and it was clearly a problem on last month's reappearance; wore cheekpieces last two starts; 5lb below her peak mark but others are currently more convincing.

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: Jumping to her right was a big problem at Bangor latest; different headgear is given a go
column37: 1-9 over fences, with the win at Kempton in November 2024 and she was a good second there (again 2m4f on good) on reappearance; however, jumping to her right, which has featured before, was a big problem when she came a remote second of four at left-handed Bangor two weeks ago; first-time blinkers replace the recent cheekpieces and tongue-tie; others preferred.

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: 5-16 chasing; prime form this February-May; much more to prove on worse than good to soft
column37: 5-16 chasing; in prime form this February-May, winning three in a row (2m4f-2m6f) before her second in valuable series final at Cheltenham (3m1f, good) and respectable third at Aintree; off since and has much more to prove on worse than good to soft but a candidate if she gets her ground.

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: Probably stretched by the extended 2m7f when second of four on chase debut latest
column37: Progressive end to last season over hurdles, winning at Chepstow before collecting a 16-runner mares' final over C&D (both on good; used to act on soft); ran respectably on last two starts this autumn, probably stretched by the extended 2m7f when second of four on chase debut latest, but she clearly has a bit more to prove over fences.

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: Dual chase winner last season; player were she to return to her peak form
column37: Acts on soft; dual chase winner last season (2m1f/2m4f) but below form over C&D on final outing; below-form third to a runaway winner over hurdles on reappearance but a player were she to return to her peak form.
column66: 13:15 | Cheltenham | She Is For Me Boys

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: 3-7 over hurdles, 0-5 chasing; gave renewed hope in this sphere last time; first headgear
column37: 3-7 over hurdles, compared to 0-5 chasing; gave renewed hope in this sphere at Naas (2m4f, soft) last time, which she needs to build on with today's first-time headgear but her Irish stable is always respected here.
column79: 13:15 | Cheltenham | She Is For Me Boys

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: Ex-Irish; up 5lb after Exeter 3m win but never better and should go well again
column37: With new connections this term, having had an extensive career for Gavin Cromwell; runner-up over an extended 2m3f on stable/seasonal debut and went one better at Exeter (upped to 3m, good) five weeks ago, taking her chase score to 3-9; Irish career suggests no problem with today's conditions; up 5lb but never better and should go well again; plenty to like.

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: Respectable, never-dangerous third on chase debut at Lingfield; this demands a lot more
column37: Dual winner over 2m3f at Fontwell as a hurdler last season; respectable, never-dangerous third on chase debut at Lingfield on latest outing but this race demands a lot more; something to prove on worse than good to soft.

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: 3-11 chasing; tailed off over hurdles latest and good ground would seemingly be preferable
column37: Won three small-field chases (3m1f/2m4f on good) for Dan Skelton this spring and 3-11 overall in this sphere; made a satisfactory stable debut but tailed off over hurdles later in October and good ground would seemingly be preferable.

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: Won handicap at Fontwell (2m3f, good) in good style on chase debut but jumped to her right
column37: 0-5 over hurdles but she won an Irish point back in 2023 and revealed herself in a radically better light when winning a ten-runner handicap at Fontwell (2m3f, good) in good style five weeks ago on chase debut; that was promising but she tended to jump to her right at those fences, which is a niggling worry, and she's 8lb higher today.

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 She Is For Me Boys, 9/2 Theonewedreamof, 7/1 Realta Liath, 9/1 Me Wee Bonnie Lass,  Sainte Doctor,  Kalista Love, 12/1 Ilovethenightlife,  Greyval,  It's Easy, 14/1 Ruby Island,  Party Vibes, 16/1 Georgi Girl,  Batwomen, 20/1 Ostrava Du Berlais, 25/1 Sunday Soldier, 40/1 Lady Jago
column36: Well below form back over fences on last two outings but she is down to a good mark
column37: 5-16 over hurdles; second of four on chase debut at Exeter last December but she did not try chasing again last term and was well below that form back over fences on her latest two outings; stays 2m5f and acts on soft, with the major plus point that she is down to a good mark.

column4: Quintessentially Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 4-Y-O Fillies INH Flat Race
column20: 15/8 Babyburn, 7/2 Brosna Shine, 7/1 Ash Hobbs, 8/1 Spring Elegance, 10/1 Araminta, 12/1 Beechingstoke,  Claudel, 14/1 Belladaball, 22/1 Easily Distracted, 25/1 Isitraininginparis,  Midnight Musical, 28/1 Let's Go Forez, 33/1 Myluckymaker, 50/1 Better Be Elusive, 66/1 Miss Kingston, 100/1 Certosa,  Hunskelper

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 4-Y-O Fillies INH Flat Race
